intro: Cerastium bialynickii, commonly known as the Bialynicki's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
